Abstract: This study explores the integration of statistical deep learning techniques for the analysis of spatial and spatiotemporal data. We propose a novel framework that combines Bayesian hierarchical models with deep learning architectures, including convolutional neural networks (CNNs), deep Gaussian processes (DGPs), and recurrent neural networks (RNNs). The framework is designed to capture complex spatial and temporal dependencies, while accounting for uncertainty through Bayesian inference. We introduce a warping mechanism to align and enhance the temporal coherence of spatiotemporal data, and incorporate reinforcement learning to optimize model parameters dynamically. The proposed approach is evaluated on a variety of real-world datasets, demonstrating superior performance in predictive accuracy and robustness compared to traditional methods. This work paves the way for more sophisticated and reliable analysis of spatiotemporal phenomena in fields such as environmental monitoring, urban planning, and epidemiology.
